intro: Astragalus renzianus, commonly known as the Renzi milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Astragalus renzianus is of interest in botanical studies due to its ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
